enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: Co-Requisite: Students must also register for Chemistry 212-2.
Add both classes to the shopping cart and submit together for successful registration. Students must be registered or completed CHEM 212-2 & 232-1 prior to registering for this course.
title: WCAS CHEM 232-2-01 Organic Chemistry Laboratory II

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
For ISP students and chemistry majors. Techniques of modern organic chemistry including NMR spectroscopy and reactions such as electrophilic aromatic substitution, esterification, Grignard reaction, aldol condensation, Robinson annulation, and Diels-Alder reaction.

Chemistry 232-2 is the laboratory course associated with Chemistry 212-2. Students enrolled in Chemistry 212-2 must also enroll in Chemistry 232-2.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisite: Grade of C- or better in Chemistry 212-1 and Chemistry 232-1.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. Turning Technologies Response Card Model QT or NXT ("Clicker")

Items Below Available From The Chemistry Department:

2. 100% Cotton Laboratory Coat
3. Laboratory Safety Glasses

subject: CHEM
